entry.title: words
entry.content:
stuck

adj./v.

1.unable to move or to be moved

eg: The weels were stuck in the mud.

2. in an unpleasant situation or place that you cannot escape from

eg.

we were stuck in traffic for over an hour.
I hate being stuck at home all day.

3. ~ on sth. unable to answer or understand sth

eg: I’ll help you if you’re stuck.

4. ~ for sth. not knowing what to do in a parcular

eg. I’ve never known him to be stuck for words before

5. ~ with sb./sth. unable to get rid of sb./sth. that you do not want

eg. I was stuck with him for the whole journey

despite

prep.

1. used to show that sth happened or is true although sth else might have happened to prevent it

syn. in spite of: Her voice was shaking despite all her efforts to control it
eg. Despite applying for hundreds of jobs, he is still out of work.

2 despite yourself: used to show that sb did not intent to do the thing mentioned

syn: in spite of
eg: He had to laugh despite himself.

bend

verb.

1. (especially of sb’s body or head) to lean, or make sth lean, in a particular direction

eg.

  • +adv./prep. field of poppies bending in the wind; She suddenly bent over, clutching her stomach.
  • ~ sth (+ adv./prep.) He bent his head and kissed her.

    2. if you bend your arm, leg, etc. or if it bends , you move it so that it is no longer straight

    ~ sth bend your knees, keeping your back straight

    Lie flat and let your kness bend.

    3. ~ sth to : to force sth that was straight into an angle or a curve

    eg.

  • The knives were bent out of shappe.
  • He bent the wire into the shape of a square.

    4. to change direction to form a curve or an angle; to make sth change direction in this way.

    eg. ~ sth Glass and water both bend light

    phrase

  • bend sb’s ear(about sth) : to talk to sb a lot about sth, especially about a problem that you have
  • bend your mind/effort to sth : to think very hard about or put a lot of effort into one particular thing
  • bend the truth : to say sth that is not completely true
  • on bended kness: if you ask for sth on bended knees, you as it in a very anxious and/or humble way(= showing you think you are less important than the person you are asking)
  • bend to sth: to be forced or persuaded to do what sb wants or to accept their opinion.
  • bend sb to sth: to force or persuade sb to do what you want or to accept your opinions: He manipulates people and tries to bend them to his will.(= make them do what he wants)

noun

1. (C) a curve or turn, especially in a road or river

2. the bends: (pl.) severe pain and difficulty in breathing experienced by a diver who comes back to the surface of the water too quickly. SYN: decompression sickness

Idioms

  • round the bend/twist(north American English around the bend): crazy
  • drive sb round the bend: to annoy sb. His attitude drives me found the bend

    word family

  • bended
  • bending
  • bends
  • bendable
  • bender
  • unbend

    shrink

    verb

    1. ~ sth to become smaller, especially when washed in water that is too hot; to make clothes, cloth, etc.

    EG: My sweater shrank in the wash.

    2. to become or to make sth smaller in size or amount

    EG

  • The tumour had strunk to the size of a pea.
  • The mark for their products is shrinking.
  • Our planet has shrunk.

    3. + adv/prep. to move back or away from sth because you are fightened or shocked

    SYN:cower He shrank back against the wall as he heard them approaching

    phrase

    1. shrink from sth

    to be unwilling to do sth that is difficult or pleasant
    EG: We made it clear to them that we would not shrink from confrontation

    2. shrink from doing sth.

    They did not shrink from doing what was right.

    IDM: a shrinking violet

    a very shy person

    noun

    a psychiatrist or psychologist

    word family

  • shrank
  • shrinking
  • shrinkage noun
  • shrunk
  • shrinkable adjective
  • shrinks

anxious

adj:

1.felling worried or nevous

EG

  • The bus was late and Sue began to get anxious.

    phrase

  • ~ about sth: I felt very anxious and depressed abot the future.
  • ~ for sb: parents are naturally anxious for their children.

    2. causing worry; showing worry

    The family faces another anxious wait for news

    3.wanting sth very much

    phrase

  • ~ to do sth: She was anxious to finish school and get a job.
  • ~ for sth: There are plenty of graduates anxious for work.
  • ~ for sb to do sth: I’m anxious that he should meet her father.

    word family

  • anxiously adv.: to ask/look/wait anxiously
  • anxiousness
  • overanxious

    anxiety

    noun.

    1.~(about/over sth) the state of feeling nervous or worried that sth bad is going to happen: acute/intense/deep anxiety

    EG: Some hospital patients experience high levels of anxiety.

    2.(psychology) a mental heath problem that causes sb to worry so much that it has a very negative effect on their daily life

    EG: Some people are feeling the pressure and suffering from anxiety and depression.

    3. a worry or fear about sth: if you’re worry about your health, share your anxieties with your doctor.

    4. a strong feeling of wanting to do sth or of wanting sth to happen.

    phrase

  • ~ to do sth: the candidate’s anxiety to win the vote.
  • ~ for sth: the people’s anxiety for the war to end.

    word family

  • anxieties
  • overanxiety

erode

1. to gradully destroy the surface of sth through the action of wind, rain, etc; to be gradually destroyed in this way.

SYN: wear away: be eroded(away)

EG

  1. The cliff face has been syeadily eroded by the sea
  2. ~(away) The rocks have eroded away over time.

    2. to gradully destroy sth or make it weaker over a period of time; to be destroyed or made weaker in this way.

    EG

  3. be eroded(by sth): Her confidence has been slowly eroded by repeated failures
  4. Mortgage payments have been eroded (= decreased in value) by inflation
  5. ~ (away): All my security has slowly eroded away.

    word famliy

  • eroded
  • erodes
  • eroding
  • erosion
  • erosive

accompany

1. to travel or go some where with sb/sth: ~ sb/sth + adv/prep.

EG

  1. His wife accompanied him on the trip.
  2. He was accompanied on the visit by his wife.
  3. (~ sb/sth) Warships will accompany the convoy.

    2. to happen or appear with sth else

    EG

  4. ~ sth: Shouts of protest accmpanied this annoncement
  5. accompanied by sth: strong winds accomped by heavy rain

    3. ~ sb (at/on sth) to play a musical instrument, especially a piano, while sb else sings or plays the main tune.

    EG: The singer was acompanied on the piano by her sister

    word family

  • accompanied
  • accompanying
  • accompanies
  • accompaniment
  • accompanyist

    advisable

    adj, sensible and a good idea in order to achieve sth
    EG:
  1. Early booking is advisable.
  2. ~ to do sth: It is advisable to book early
    OPP: inadvisable
    advisability noun

    convey

    1. to make ideas, feeling,. known to sb

    SYN: communicate: ~ sth

    EG:

  3. Colours like red convey a sense of energy and strength.
  4. ~ sth to sb: please convey my apologies to your wife.
  5. ~ how, what, etc…: He tried desperately to convey how urgent the situation was.
  6. ~ that …: She did not wish to convey that they were all at fault.

    2. ~ sb/sth (from …) (to …) to take, carry or transport sb/sth from one place to another: Pipes convey hot water from the boiler to the radiators.

    word family

  • conveyed
  • conveying
  • conveys
  • conveyor
  • conveyance
  • conveyable
  • conveyer

distort

1. (~ sth) to change the shape, apperance or sound of sth so that it is strange or not clear

EG:

  1. a fairground mirror that distorts your shape
  2. The loudspeaker seemed to distort his voive.

    2.to change facts, ideas,etc. so that they no longer correct or true.

    EG: Newspapers are often guilty of distorting the truth.

    intrusive

    1. too direct, easy to notice, etc in a way that is annoying or upsetting: intrusive questions

    EG: The constant presence of the media was very intrusive

    2. (of a speech sound) produced in order to link two words together when speeking, for exxample the r sound produced at the end of low by some English speakers in the phrase ‘low and order’. some people do not consider intrusive ‘r’ a feature of standard English.

    terse

adj
use few words and often not seeming polite or friendly: a terse style
EG : The president issued a terse statement denying the charges

word family

  • tersely
  • terseness

    bias

    noun.

    1. a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgement: accusations of political bias in news programmes (= that reports are unfair and show favour to one political party)

    EG

  1. Employers must cinsuder all candidates impartially and without bias
  2. Some institutions still have a strong bias against women.
  3. The article examines gender bias in our schools.

    2. an interest in one thing more than others; a special ability: the course has a strong practical bias.

    3. the fact that the results of research or an experiment are not accurate because a particular factor has not been considered when collecting the information.

    EG: If a response rate is low, the risk of bias in the finding will be great.

    4. the bias of a piece of cloth is an edge cut.

    verb.

    1. ~ sb/sth (against/towards/in favour of sb/sth) to unfairly influence sb’s opinions or decisions

    SYN: prejudice: the newspapers have biased people against her.

    2. ~ sth: to have an effet on the results of research or an experiment contained an error which could bias the results.

entry.title: stances
entry.content:
1. life’s not out to get you

Sometimes things will bend you
But trust me you'll be fine
I've been moving mountains that I once had to climb
And life's not out to get you
Despite the things you've been through
Because what you give is what you get
And it doesn't make sense to make do

entry.title: phrase
entry.content:
1. never before
  2. concenive of: form a mental image of something that is not present or that is not the case
  3. close to

entry.title: CentOS7安装jdk17
entry.content:
1.确定是否安装java

rpm -qa|grep java java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64 javapackages-tools-3.4.1-11.el7.noarch java-1.7.0-openjdk-1.7.0.261-2.6.22.2.el7_8.x86_64 java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64 tzdata-java-2021a-1.el7.noarch java-1.7.0-openjdk-headless-1.7.0.261-2.6.22.2.el7_8.x86_64 python-javapackages-3.4.1-11.el7.noarch java-1.8.0-openjdk-headless-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64`

2.卸载已安装的jdk

[root@CentOS7-1 ~]# rpm -e –nodeps java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64`

[root@CentOS7-1 ~]``# rpm -e --nodeps java-1.7.0-openjdk-1.7.0.261-2.6.22.2.el7_8.x86_64

[root@CentOS7-1 ~]``# rpm -e --nodeps java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64

[root@CentOS7-1 ~]``# rpm -e --nodeps java-1.7.0-openjdk-headless-1.7.0.261-2.6.22.2.el7_8.x86_64

`[root@CentOS7-1 ~]# rpm -e --nodeps java-1.8.0-openjdk-headless-1.8.0.282.b08-1.el7_9.x86_64

3.安装jdk

wget https://download.oracle.com/java/17/latest/jdk-17_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz tar xf jdk-17_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz mv jdk-17.0.3/ /usr/lib/jvm

4.配置环境

‘vim /etc/profile‘
a.在末尾添加：
``# Java Env`

export JAVA_HOME=``/alidata/server/java/jdk17

export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME``/bin`` b.使profile生效 source /etc/profile`

5.确认版本

java -version
#java #centos7
